brief_summary.textblock:
Ovarian torsion is one of the gynecological emergency. This complication requires high
      clinical suspicion and early detection, to prevent permanent loss of ovarian function. The
      long uterine ovarian ligament could be a risk factor for ovarian torsion. We want to measure
      the uterine ovarian ligament length during routine laparoscopy/laparotomy and to compare the
      length between the torsion group and other non torsion patients

clinical_study.brief_title: The Length of Uteroovarian Ligament and the Risk of Ovarian Torsion

detailed_description.textblock:
Female patient who are going to undergo laparoscopy/laparotomy for any gynecological reason
      will ask to participate. During the operation the uteroovarian ligament length will  be
      measure by sterile ruler (calibrated plastic device 1 mm in diameter).

      The length of uteroovarian ligament will compared between the patient who will diagnose with
      ovarian torsion (study group) and the other women (control group)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Indication for gynecological operation

          -  hemodynamically stable

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Ovarian torsion in the past

          -  History of pelvic inflammatory disease (PID)

intervention.intervention_name: Measure of uteroovarian ligament length during gynecological surgery

clinical_study.keyword: the length of uterine ovarian ligament

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Screening
